title: You Don't Mess with the Zohan
short_plot_summary: A skilled Israeli counter-terrorism agent fakes his own death to move to New York City and become a hair stylist. He falls in love and must eventually confront his past.
explanation: A detective, representing Zohan's past as an Israeli counter-terrorism agent
A pair of scissors, showcasing Zohan's desire to switch from being a soldier to a hairdresser
A shower, a reference to the funny scenes where Zohan washes client's hair vigorously
A bowl of food, to symbolize the diversity and culture in the movie, particularly Zohan's love for hummus
A heart-eyed emoji, highlighting the love story between Zohan and hair salon owner Dalia
